raw_response:
Tefina, specifically the Djerban Jewish Shabbat stew variant known as Tefina or Pkaïla, **appears as a thick, dark, almost black stew** with a dense, slow-cooked consistency. It is neither soupy nor a solid but more like a hearty stew or ragout. This deep color comes from caramelized greens (traditionally spinach or chard) cooked down extensively, sometimes with caramelization of sugars in vegan versions using seitan or tofu to replace meat[2][5].
